intro: Ailuroschia scabriseta, commonly known as the rough-hairy lichen, is a member of the family Verrucariaceae. It is a foliose lichen characterized by its irregular, lobed thallus with a rough, hairy surface. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on decaying wood or stone. Its structure consists of a symbiotic partnership between a photosynthetic alga and a fungal mycelium. Ailuroschia scabriseta is typically found in temperate regions and is known for its resilience in humid climates.
